Utterance: Hi! It’s good to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing pretty well. I reached out to a couple of friends.
That’s fantastic! How did those conversations go?
They were really positive. It felt good to reconnect and share what I’ve been going through.
I’m so glad to hear that! It sounds like you’re building a supportive network. How did it feel to share your journey with them?
It felt freeing, actually. I didn’t realize how much I needed that.
That’s wonderful! Connection can be incredibly healing. Have you been able to incorporate any of your mom’s recipes since we last spoke?
Yes! I made one for a small gathering with friends, and they loved it. It brought back some great memories.
That’s beautiful! It sounds like you’re creating new memories while honoring her. How did that experience feel for you?
It was really emotional but in a good way. I felt like she was there with us.
That’s so special. It’s important to find ways to keep that connection alive. Have you thought about any other rituals or practices to remember her?
I’ve been thinking about writing down some of my favorite memories and recipes.
That’s a lovely idea! It could serve as a keepsake for you and your friends. Shifting gears a bit, how has your temper been lately?
I’ve had a couple of moments, but I’ve been able to catch myself before it escalates.
That’s progress! It’s great that you’re recognizing those feelings. Have you been practicing your breathing exercises regularly?
Yes, I’ve made it a habit. It really helps in those tense moments.
That’s wonderful to hear! Consistency is key. Have you faced any new challenges at work that have tested your patience?
A few. There was a project deadline that had everyone stressed, but I managed to stay calm.
That’s impressive! It seems like you’re applying what we’ve discussed. How did it feel to maintain that calmness?
It felt empowering. I was proud of myself for not losing my cool.
You should be proud! It’s a significant achievement. As we wrap up today, what goals would you like to set for the upcoming week?
I want to keep reaching out to friends and maybe start that memory book for my mom.
Those are beautiful goals. I look forward to hearing how those go next time. Remember, you’re making meaningful strides in your journey.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re doing the work, and it’s paying off. Take care, and I’ll see you next time!
Bye!
